reviewText: It was hard watching this story about rich boy loves poor girl .Socially uneceptable of some backwards small town ignorant father . I had to fast foward this very poorly wriiten script . It had no originality although the actor who played Lucas did a fair job . I wanted to just scream at this abusive and ignorant story .Its characters the parents lacking all moral compass .Never less portraying good church going people. Watching the father beating his son with a belt and verbally abusing his child was just a really bad tale of ignorance . The ending was as predictable  as the script . Don't even bother watching this or you could just fast forward as I did . Yawwwwwwnnnnn .
Title: What Matters Most

reviewText: I was looking at gay films when this movie appeared along with other gay movies as a suggested film of interest to me. Naturally thinking it was a gay film I read the Amazon description and thought the struggle of 2 teens relationship to be gay and happy in a small town would be interesting. Wrong.I watched the film wanting to turn it off so many times because the story line was extremely boring but I was waiting for a gay teen to appear. The movie is about 2 straight teens. I was very dissapointed but so frustrated that the movie lacked any kind of intelligent writing or acting. The ending is quite laughable.This movie is as flat as the Texas landscape that they mention. I cannot find any redeeming quality to recommend this to anyone. I see the other reviewers gave this movie 5 stars and I wonder if they saw the same movie I did. I would actually give it -2 stars for wasting my time and money.
summary: Hallmark-Type Boring Straight Movie of the Week
Title: What Matters Most

reviewText: A very poorly done film.The plot was boring and slow moving and the hero's parents were terrible parents.  They both loved status and prestige and didn't care about their son's opinions.  The daughter was given too muchattention and the father gave her the love rather than the son.The abuse by the father to the son was inexcusable.  Such abuse can destroy a child.The only good part was the ending, but I don't believe the father would have changed so much at the end.Caution you not to see this film.
Title: What Matters Most

reviewText: This is how my life started out I can relate, and so can many people, Love can overcome at host of situations, and this is just one way of telling What Matters Most! Excellent!
Title: What Matters Most

reviewText: We enjoyed this movie and were especially pleased with the emphasis on FAITH in the movie. If you are believer you will like this movie.
Title: What Matters Most

reviewText: I thought it was a nice movie I enjoyed it :)it's about love conquering all through family through anything when there is real love. ::)
Title: What Matters Most

reviewText: Big time Hollywood movie this ain't; however, it is a good movie.  Sweet story of two teens in small town USA fighting shame and expectations of others.  Twist in the plot is a pleasant surprise.
Title: What Matters Most

reviewText: Loved this movie because it is so true to life.  It goes to prove that it's what in a person's heart that shows the true characteristics of them.  It also proves that even though some people may have a higher standard of living than others it makes them no better.
Title: What Matters Most

reviewText: Once you realize that this is one of the worst attempts at drama ever, you appreciate it as one of the better comedies ever produced.  The writing is SO bad, the acting is wretched and the stereotypes are so cliche, that it's wonderful.  This is one of the those movies that you'll watch again because it is so BAD that it will make you roll in the floor laughing!  The ending was priceless, pathetic and hilarious!!!
summary: Billed to be a drama, turned out to be one of the most hilarious comedies ever!!!
Title: What Matters Most
